place_description: Locally owned neighborhood coffee shop in the heart of NoDa, Charlotte’s Arts District. Serving up locally roasted coffee, pastries, and rotating art! Visit our website for info on our seasonal selections, monthly events, or to order catering. We hope to see you soon!

reviews_data.review_text: Small gourmet coffee shop  great atmosphere
The coffee is good. The service is slow. Convenient parking.
Nice shop, but parking and coffee were not good. Coffee weak and fruity. Very disappointed with the whole experienced, dumped 3 coffees.

I love Summit Coffee! Always have an awesome experience. The staff is very friendly and full of recommendations. The spring special chocolate covered strawberry iced coffee is so delicious. My summer favorite is Blue Skies. The blueberry cold foam is awesome!

Had the chocolate covered strawberry iced coffee and it was amazing. Not only that but my son and I spoke and connected with the owner who impacted our day in such a positive way!! Can't wait to come back here:)
Absolutely love this place. Such a welcoming staff and environment. Hands down the best iced vanilla latte.

Asked for a simple customization to my drink due to dietary restrictions. The barista was confused why someone would order that to the other staff member. I ignored it as I was pretty tired to care about their opinions on a drink that I paid for.

30 mins later my stomach is completely messed and the drink was indeed not made the way I asked. I've had an upset stomach all day because they couldn't follow very simple directions.

I was stranded in Charlotte for 2 days because of a cancelled flight during a layover. Slightly depressed, slightly anxious between the canceled flight and all the unfortunate things that happened afterwards. But the coffee here fixed that. The espresso had such great flavor profile, I even bought a bag to bring home. Also - the staff here are amazing. Very friendly attentive. Had my little therapy session here (thanks Vicky!) They also told me where to go around the area, which was very nice and helpful, turning a failed layover stay into a cool little adventure. Highly recommend!

We were in the area and just typed in coffee shops near me, via Google; this was the first one walking distance from us.

I am glad we stopped by! I enjoy lavender in my coffee and not alone of coffee shops offer it! Sumit did!

I also love the interior, it was a small but cozy feel, the decor is fun to look at. The space invites you to hang out and sip and stay for a while.. and did I mention they have one of the best chocolate chip cookies I have ever had! Next time I'm trying food. Prices are slightly high but the taste and quality is there to compensate for it. Not bad for a every so often coffee shop drinker like myself.
love it i will go back
I am a decaf drinker, and I ordered a drink that was certainly good enough. I'd go back.
My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte!  I love the inclusion of work from local artists on the walls and the drinks and service are top notch.

I've been to them before, bought coffee, went to use the restroom without buying coffee, they turned me away! strange rule, buy coffee to use the toilet? bad experience, I will go to coffee shops of another company!
Love their seasonal menus! Great service and coffee.
Favorite place for coffee in Noda. Good vibes, friendly staff and great coffee.
Great vibes and very good coffee!

Friendliest staff - quality baristas that will remember your name and order if you are a regular customer - delicious coffee- beautiful art- good vibe music- one of my favorite local coffee spots - top tier!

I love this coffee shop! Every time I go in, the baristas are nothing but kind, and they have great recommendations! The drinks are delicious and the service is excellent, making it one of my favorite places in NoDa. It is a comforting environment and I always feel welcome--special shout-out to Amelia and Kayla, they always bring a fantastic energy!!
Only had a latte. It was very good.

Pretty substandard coffee shop. The water at the side bar was empty. For "sanatary" reasons they wouldn't refill my cup they gave me a few minutes prior (even though the menu says save $.50 when you bring your own) the avocado toast was very below standard of most coffee shops. The amount of tea they give you is insane, probably 5x the amount of tea they needed to put in the bag,  and made it bitter since it easily over brewed. The chai was pretty damn good though.

-Good costumer service
-Coffee tasting is awesome
-safe and beautiful area
-prices are high

The Summit NoDa girls always make me feel so loved - they perfect my order every time and call me by name when I walk in whether I'm popping in to pick up my online order or hanging for a while to get some work done. Can we also talk about how much of a winter wonderland it is in there right now?! Cozy and festive. Also love enjoying the fresh air while it's not too cold!

Coffee and service was poor at best. When we walked in the staffed neglected to greet us ,however, intentionally greeted other guest that entered. The lifted the garage door (it was 37 degrees outside) without considering the guest that we're enjoying the establishment. Everyone put their jackets on our left. At $6.00 a cup, I think you can find a much better establishment.

I've gone to Summit Coffee Noda for a few months now and, have to say, the staff is very friendly, they almost always welcome me by name, ask me how I'm doing. The atmosphere is quite inviting and their Mochas are great. I highly recommend.
Best iced coffee, period. Cultural hub. Locally owned and community building A+.
Cute coffee shop!
This place is great!  The people working are what make it the best. <3 sister/mother Theresa
Best coffee in town! ...probably because the beans are super gay. 10s across the boards.
Unfortunately nether latter or cappuccino was bad . Particularly no flavour and no latter art , overheated and bubbly foam. But the interior is cute.
Nice place to have a cup of coffee. However, I feel their coffee has high acidity. Also, they rarely have any baked good available in the afternoon (at least the one I like)
Fun people watching place with really good coffee and snacks !

Based on the photos, I thought I was getting something different. Being a barista, I thought the lattes were way too foamy and there was no latte art. Not a-lot of flavor choices which is fine for the residential area and the food was ok. It was super hard to have conversations when the loud train drove by and then there were people using leaf blowers right by the door. It is small so the tables and chairs make it hard to maneuver. Lastly, good coffee shops are inclusive when the only flag they have is the American flag. I felt terrible bringing my Christian friends there with the huge pride flag in front.
Fantastic light roast, High Tide. Highly recommend it just black.
weak latte, not even hot

I have been going to Summit since we moved here last September. They are beyond great and the coffee/food/pastries are excellent. The staff is amazing and this morning the owner gave me this because I told her my brother in law's Birthday was on may 4th and that his dog passed away the night before! He was thrilled when my wife and I showed it to him on FaceTime! Excellent all around from the service to the people!

I was just in town for a couple of weeks for a work trip and had the chance to chill here and get some work done remotely...super cute atmosphere, very friendly staff, and I highly recommend the strawberry cream cold brew. It sounded strange to me at first but I quickly understood after my first sip. Great place to get work done and have great coffee.
Great service
Coffee is really good and it's a cute place. Recommend!

It's a small coffee shop with a good selection of coffee and even specialty choices. There are pastries that don't look dry or bad (I didn't try them sadly). There is not a lot of space inside nor out, so this is not a place for a large group, but its great for 3 people or less.
The parking is horrible, so heads up on that.
I love their iced coffee more than anything here. And the staff is super friendly. Highly recommend!

I just met my friend here, and the ambiance was incredible. I've never been to this location before, and I didn't know what tea I wanted. So I asked the barista for her recommendation, trusted her, and I was not disappointed with it at all! It was quiet, more than enough tables to sit inside or outside, and overall, just a very pleasant experience. I will be back!
Delicious decaf almond milk latte with lavender!
Great place and good service. Seating was tough to find inside but lot of chairs outside.

Cute little coffee place, pretty small space but some seating available. On the pricier side for drinks, and the syrup/brew in my pumpkin pie had an odd grainy texture towards the end that I didn't enjoy.
Wonderful coffee and beautiful atmosphere. The location is next to the light rail, making it convenient to get to the numerous venues in the city. Great service and prices!
Nice little coffee shop! We had a matcha and a cappuccino and both were good.
Not a lot of seating if you're looking to work, limited outlets as well. But great coffee and service.
The place is cute and great for working! It's decked out in holiday decor right now which is nice. The baristas are so friendly. There is a parking lot with 2 hour free retail parking.
Always a great experience. Love the atmosphere to hang with friends or get work done on my laptop. Huge fan of their seasonal drinks!

Love this place! I recently had a hot chai latte, but have enjoyed so many different drinks. The team is helpful and I really like how cozy it is. My husband and I have off on  Wednesdays and love to start here with coffee and a muffin : )

Beautiful place with high quality coffee and syrups with real spices and authentic flavors. I love that they support local artists and crafts-people with the products they display on the shelves. I've bought a local candle and later a pair of handmade earrings there too, plus their store merchandise is always cute!
This coffee shop is hands down the best in Charlotte. The staff, ever changing art work, and just overall feel of the place makes my heart happy! Grab a coffee, tea, or even wine and sit and relax!

I was excited to try Summit since I've heard great things, but was super disappointed in the quality of the latte. The staff was really friendly, but the latte was just straight up bad. I'm not sure what happened or if this is just how it always tastes, but I got a hot PSL and it was insanely watered down. I ordered it with whole milk, and it tastes like it was made with a mix of skim and water. Plus there didn't seem to be much espresso in there. It tasted like half a shot for the 12oz of "milk"? This was the worst latte I've ever had in my life. I wasted $6 on this and it was still worth it to toss it out. When I was pouring it down the sink too it even looked super watery. Not sure what the hype is about, but save yourself $7 and try another coffee shop or make it at home. I can seriously make a better tasting latte at home with my Nespresso.
Friendly staff, neat atmosphere. Coffee was fresh and fantastic. Also got a pastry that was delicious. Will be back.

We were in town for a conference and tried this lovely coffee shop on the way to the airport. They have some seriously delicious coffee and baked goods. I tried oat milk latte, and my friends got regular latte and decaf cappuccino. I really loved that they give you glasses to fill up your water, not cheap plastic cups. Inside is nicely decorated and you feel like you are entering into an oasis. They also have some outdoor seating which we enjoyed. I will go back next time I am in town.
Nice

Maple Sea Salt Latte. 10/10

I loved that there was outdoor seating and I even found a table near an outlet I could plug my laptop into. It was a small/intimate space and was just what I needed for today's mentorship meeting. Will definitely keep this spot in mind for future meeting/consultation/admin time.
I love Summit Noda. They do not charge for non-dairy milk. Yay! Love their vegan pumpkin choc chip muffin & the app is super convenient.
Insanely overpriced

Got a tangerine ginger iced tea and loved it! A very friendly and cozy environment to hang out. Fun rainbow flags and NoDa merch. They have some flyers on the wall of lgbt socials and groups that I found really helpful too!
Cute store, friendly staff, and great coffee. Couldn't ask for more!
Best coffee in NODA! The atmosphere, coffee, and employees are all wonderful!

Let me give you my edited version that isn't as harsh but honest - worth posting on Google! :

"My second visit in. The workers were
kind which is why I even gave 2 stars.
The atmosphere is strange here. They
have dark occult art on the wall,
which doesn't complement the aesthetic
unless they are communicating their
love for the occult (I did not appreciate the workers' conversations making fun of their moms' love for
Jesus).

One piece of "art" that was particularly
uncomfortable to look at was the one on the center of
the wall. It had the word
MISANTHROPE, which means to hate mankind, and also the words 'city of fools.'

The chai tea I ordered was not flavorful but watery; it tasted like warm cinnamon water. Also tried a lemonade matcha, but that tasted
like a lemon Le Croix.

I cannot recommend this place at all.
Best coffee in Charlotte
Beautiful space, love the location. Had some really fun specials. Delish desserts! Cortado was o.k. iced latte was a bit sweet for me, but overall good. :) Great experience!
Best coffee and service in charlotte
Best coffee!!!
Got a croissant and the barista recommended the Shake it Off. It's a lavender latte with oat milk. So good! Nice staff, good music, and relaxing atmosphere

Absolutely love Summit Coffee! The people here are so nice. I tried their lavender oat milk latte for anyone wondering and it was perfect! Their other options are amazing too. Walking distance from the lightrail too!!! Pics to come!
Great latte and friendly staff. It was nice going to a smaller chain rather than the typical Starbucks or Dunkin for a change.
My favorite coffee spot!! The staff is so friendly and the atmosphere is welcoming. Best coffee in town!!!

It's the best coffee I've had in Charlotte. The service here is the type that makes you say "wow, they were so nice" right after they take your order. And the ambience is nice and cozy. It's a smaller place with a little bit of outdoor seating so I wouldn't plan to get a seat on the weekend, but to just take it to-go! Lastly... if you see an apple turnover in the case.. you should buy it.

Wow what a lovely place! I loved the atmosphere and the vibe of this place. I ordered the vanilla oat milk latte, and Parker did beautiful latte art. The staff was all very kind and welcoming. I work at a coffee shop out of town and chatted with them for a bit, and they even gave me pointers for getting the hang of latte art. Will 100% be coming back next time I'm in the CLT area!

Very good espresso.

Staff was stand-offish.
Did not feel comfortable there.
Glad they had outside seating.
Not likely to come back as there are plenty of option that are more welcoming.

Too bad.
I like independent shops and seek them out.
Specifically for good products and friendly service.

The people were very friendly and welcoming, however the products were a disappointment. I had a dirty chai, which tasted like it was about 90% water and had very little flavor and also a blueberry muffin, which had blueberries in it but was closer to a bran muffin in texture and flavor. My friend had an Americano, which she indicated tasted burned and weak, and also an apple butter galette, which was good. Presentation was beautiful, I just wish the experience was as good. I doubt I will go back since it was a bit of a drive for me anyway. I wanted to like it!
The best damn coffee, baristas, and vibe in town!

The best drip coffee you'll find in the Charlotte metro, hands down. I also highly recommend buying their beans if you're a third wave coffee fan, I brew Summit beans with a Chemex and find it rivals every high end bean I've bought. Lattes etc are good too.

Went for a t-shirt my son asked me to pick up for him. Decided to try their fall latte. It was delicious! Just the right amount of fall spice paired with a hint of orange. Definitely going back before it's gone!
Great spot to wake up!

This is one of my favorite places to get coffee.  The staff is always very friendly with great service.  Coffee and ambiance are great for studying or reading a book.  I usually order on the app and get my food to go, another convenient option.  Glad they're in the neighborhood :)
Great Coffee taste, Pricy, needs more options, great decor.

This place is so great. They have fantastic coffee, frozen drinks and they also have beer. They are open till 7 on Sundays (much later than Smelly Cat down the street). Also they have a wonderful staff who are knowledgeable, kind and eager to help! I'd give this place 6/5 stars if I could!!!!!!!!!!!!!
This place is adorable! The baristas were friendly and I was happy they could make my favorite drink (matcha+lavender). Seems like a nice place to journal or hang out with a friend
Love this location and the barista's are amazing !!!

Great locally roasted coffee! I've bought a fair amount of espresso drinks and drip coffee here, and I got their house roast beans which were fresh and not too dark! Thd cold brew was prepackaged apparently from one of their main locations and seemed a bit overpriced but was fine.
Staff was extremely nice and super delicious coffee
Super nice peeps & the latte is worth the $$$
Great coffee and staff!

Really nice spot with a lot of other great places around. I used to go to the Summit in Davidson a lot when I was in school up there, so it's nice to have one so close to home so I can continue to support them.
Best on the planet!
Stopped by after dinner and the baristas here are so lovely and friendly.  The coffee is really flavorful and delicious!

Talk about which essential morning cup of coffee! We had a great experience here thanks to Madison! Fantastic coffee, delicious scones, of which the lemon and lavender one was a delightful surprise! Utter perfection. The beautiful decor for me to feel as soon as you walk in. Definitely go support as possible business, esp if you're getting some Jeni's next door!

Very lovely coffee shop. Great,  great coffee,  atmosphere,  and service.  I love the matching color scheme,  the open space,  and outside area.
Definitely a cute spot for good coffee,  pastries,  and even a reading spot.  So glad we stopped by!
Yummy iced latte - smooth espresso and nice winter spice flavor  served with quick, friendly service!
Great neighborhood coffee shop! Wish there was an option to write in your tip amount on the app.
Very nice staff and great atmosphere
